snippet: Many young Egyptians say the government’s heavy-handed reaction to protests has hampered their ability to establish a role in shaping the nation’s future.
abstract: Many young Egyptians say government's heavy-handed crackdown on any opposition is hindering their ability to shape nation's future and widening generation gap; youth have come to resent older generation for keeping country mired in economic, cultural and political stagnation, and for maintaining control over its direction.

byline.original: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: Many young Egyptians say the government’s heavy-handed reaction to protests has hampered their ability to establish a role in shaping the nation’s future.

headline.main: In Egypt, a Chasm Grows Between Young and Old
headline.print_headline: In Egypt, a Chasm Grows Between Young and Old

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
